metadata.title: CVE-2020-15168 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
node-fetch before versions 2.6.1 and 3.0.0-beta.9 did not honor the size option after following a redirect, which means that when a content size was over the limit, a FetchError would never get thrown and the process would end without failure. For most people, this fix will have a little or no impact. However, if you are relying on node-fetch to gate files above a size, the impact could be significant, for example: If you don't double-check the size of the data after fetch() has completed, your JS thread could get tied up doing work on a large file (DoS) and/or cost you money in computing.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-15168` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-fetch - 2.6.1-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-fetch package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.1-3').
